  "description": "The Way It Fits (tWIF) is a fashion brand that has always prided itself on producing bespoke and ready-to-wear premium clothing that are both sustainable and affordable.We manufacture a wide range of clothing items, including shirts, suits, native attires, pants, as well as branded clothing for companies and other businesses. Additionally, we offer after-sales services such as alterations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Campaign and Marketing Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Develop and execute marketing campaigns for:


	Store launches (e.g., new locations, exclusive openings, client experiences
	Seasonal sales (Black Friday, festive, anniversary, etc.)
	New product and collection releases
	Create data-driven marketing strategies that increase store traffic and online conversions.
	Social Media Management, and Ads promotion.
	Plan content calendars and campaign timelines
	Manage influencer partnerships, collaborations, and PR placements to strengthen brand presence.
	Track and analyze campaign performance, providing insights and recommendations.
	Work with the Creative Director to ensure campaigns align with tWIF&rsquo;s aesthetic and voice.
	Supervise marketing materials, photoshoots, lookbooks, newsletters, ads, and social media visuals.
	Maintain consistency across all brand communication channels (digital, in-store, and experiential).


Requirements


	A creative mindset with a strong grasp of current trends in fashion and content.
	2+ years of experience in fashion, lifestyle, or retail marketing.
	Strong understanding of brand positioning, digital strategy, and campaign execution.
	Excellent written and visual communication skills.
	Proficiency in social media marketing, Meta Ads, and campaign analytics.
	Ability to work independently, manage deadlines, and collaborate across teams.


Preferred Qualities:


	Experience managing campaigns for fashion or lifestyle brands.
	An eye for aesthetics and detail (TWIF-level precision).
	Resourceful, results-oriented, and innovative thinker.
	Proximity to Ikeja is an added advantage


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr.twifclothing@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Campaign and Marketing Manager Job at the Way It Fits Clothing




        
    

        
        The Way It Fits (tWIF) is a fashion brand that has always prided itself on producing bespoke and ready-to-wear premium clothing that are both sustainable and affordable.We manufacture a wide range of clothing items, including shirts, suits, native attires, pants, as well as branded clothing for companies and other businesses. Additionally, we offer after-sales services such as alterations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Campaign and Marketing Manager
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Develop and execute marketing campaigns for:

	Store launches (e.g., new locations, exclusive openings, client experiences
	Seasonal sales (Black Friday, festive, anniversary, etc.)
	New product and collection releases
	Create data-driven marketing strategies that increase store traffic and online conversions.
	Social Media Management, and Ads promotion.
	Plan content calendars and campaign timelines
	Manage influencer partnerships, collaborations, and PR placements to strengthen brand presence.
	Track and analyze campaign performance, providing insights and recommendations.
	Work with the Creative Director to ensure campaigns align with tWIF’s aesthetic and voice.
	Supervise marketing materials, photoshoots, lookbooks, newsletters, ads, and social media visuals.
	Maintain consistency across all brand communication channels (digital, in-store, and experiential).


Requirements


	A creative mindset with a strong grasp of current trends in fashion and content.
	2+ years of experience in fashion, lifestyle, or retail marketing.
	Strong understanding of brand positioning, digital strategy, and campaign execution.
	Excellent written and visual communication skills.
	Proficiency in social media marketing, Meta Ads, and campaign analytics.
	Ability to work independently, manage deadlines, and collaborate across teams.


Preferred Qualities:


	Experience managing campaigns for fashion or lifestyle brands.
	An eye for aesthetics and detail (TWIF-level precision).
	Resourceful, results-oriented, and innovative thinker.
	Proximity to Ikeja is an added advantage


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.twifclothing@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Business Development Manager Job at African Industries Group




        
    

        
        African Industries Group (AIG) is a diversified global conglomerate with a legacy of 52 years of business excellence and sustainable growth. It is headquartered in Lagos, Nigeria. It has been contributing to Nigeria’s socio-economic growth and industrial development and is equally committed towards the nurturing and development of the local community.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager
Job Location: Ogijo - Shagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are currently seeking a Business Development Manager to lead strategic business initiatives, ensure adherence to industry rules and regulations, and drive revenue growth in the Shagamu/Ogijo Cluster of Ogun State.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute business strategies to grow market share and revenue within the cluster.
	Ensure compliance with electricity sector rules, regulations, and policies as stipulated by the Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission (NERC) and other governing bodies.
	Identify, evaluate, and pursue new business opportunities and partnerships in the electricity distribution market.
	Monitor regulatory changes, analyze their impact on operations, and implement required adjustments.
	Build and manage relationships with stakeholders, including regulatory authorities, local communities, and business partners.
	Oversee customer engagement initiatives aimed at improving satisfaction, retention, and service delivery.
	Prepare business performance reports and present insights to senior management.
	Lead and mentor the commercial and business development teams within the cluster.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Electrical Engineering, or any related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in business development or regulatory affairs within the power, utilities, or energy sector.
	Sound understanding of electricity market operations, compliance frameworks, and NERC regulations.
	Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
	Strategic thinker with excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and business analytics tools.


Personal Attributes:


	Results-driven, ethical, and proactive.
	Strong attention to detail and regulatory compliance.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure and deliver measurable outcomes.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jamal.ogidan@africanindustries.com using “Business Development Manager – Shagamu/Ogijo Cluster” as the subject of the mail.

Job Position: Product Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Role Overview


	We are looking for a Product Manager to join Kuda’s Fraud Prevention squad. In this role, you will focus on the strategy, development, and optimization of features aimed at preventing fraud across our platform.
	You’ll work on enhancing fraud detection mechanisms, reducing risks, and ensuring that Kuda continues to deliver secure and trustworthy financial services to our customers.
	You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Science, Engineering, Fraud Operation teams among others, to implement fraud prevention measures and ensure a seamless and secure user experience.
	This is a key role in helping us protect our customers and maintain Kuda’s reputation as a reliable, secure platform for digital banking.

Officer, Logistics Job at Deloitte Nigeria




        
    

        
        Deloitte Nigeria - Our client is a visionary healthcare management organization at the forefront of modernizing and elevating secondary healthcare delivery in Imo State, Nigeria. Recently reconstituted to enhance operational efficiency and administrative excellence, this dynamic institution is committed to ensuring that residents across the state have access to affordable, high-quality healthcare services. By leveraging innovative management practices and strategic oversight, they are reshaping the landscape of public healthcare, fostering an environment where both patients and healthcare professionals thrive.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



As part of their ambitious growth and transformation agenda, they are recruiting passionate, skilled, and forward-thinking candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Officer, Logistics

Job Location: Owerri, Imo
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Officer, Logistics plays a critical role in ensuring the seamless operation of supply chain and logistical activities across our network of healthcare facilities.
	This position is responsible for coordinating the procurement, distribution, and inventory management of medical and administrative supplies, as well as supporting the efficient movement of personnel and resources.
	By maintaining robust logistical systems, the role directly contributes to the organization’s ability to deliver high-quality healthcare services and achieve operational excellence.
	Collaboration with HR Operations and facility managers is essential to align logistics with workforce planning and organizational goals.


Responsibilities


	Oversee the procurement, storage, and distribution of medical and administrative supplies, ensuring timely availability and cost-effective management.
	Maintain accurate records of inventory levels, track usage patterns, and implement systems to prevent stockouts or excess stock.
	Organize the transportation of personnel, equipment, and supplies between facilities, optimizing routes and schedules for efficiency.
	Ensure adherence to organizational policies, healthcare regulations, and safety standards; prepare regular reports on logistical performance and challenges.
	Work closely with HR Operations, facility managers, and external vendors to align logistics with workforce needs and operational priorities.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
	3 - 5 years of experience in logistics, supply chain management, or a related field, preferably within healthcare or public sector organizations.
	Professional certification in logistics or supply chain management (e.g., CILT, CSCP) is an advantage.
	Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills; proficiency in inventory management software; excellent communication and negotiation abilities.
	Familiarity with healthcare logistics, regulatory requirements, and best practices in supply chain management.
	Must be a resident of Imo State or open to relocation.
